title: Verify lock and checkout with patron in cart for package
custom_preconds:
-Create a new events or Package and PEL(or use existing)
-Create a package/associate an existing package and if its new package associate the created events in step above
- make sure the event, PEL and package are on-sale
-make sure the API user has sale access to the above package and PEL (any other permission like payment, deliveries, patron match)
custom_test_purpose: to implement the component test cases for MPV sales flow with patron in cart

custom_steps_separated.content:
Do a V2 GetPackages call
GET /api/v2/packages/3139/
note: 3139 is the package id.
custom_steps_separated.expected:
verify the payload to have the following values:
referenceDate to match with reference data of the package defined in PV
packageAccess details to have Status: ON_sale(condition to execute the next step)
ID to mactch with the one provided in the '3139'

custom_steps_separated.content:
Select the method as POST
Run Lock Seat v2 API for Package
host/api/v2/lock

{"lockSeats":{"packageList":{"id":3138},"transactionPatronAccount":{"id":38360},"numberOfSeats":2,"creditsRequested":true,"saleType":"PACKAGE","buyerTypeSeatsList":[{"buyerType":{"id":1422},"seats":[{"index":4295},{"index":4294}]}],"accessible":"false","package":{"id":3139}}}
custom_steps_separated.expected:
response code: 200
1) Extract the e-tag to pass for the assign delivery
validate these are present:
2) availableDeliveryCardTypes
3) availableDeliveryMethods
4) availablePaymentMethods
6) availableWallets
7) jsonResponseObject.cart.id
8) cartExpirationSeconds
9) jsonResponseObject.cart.totalSalesRevenue.value
and 
10) transactionPatronAccount matches with the patron provided in the payload for the request.

custom_steps_separated.content:
make an Assign delivery call(PUT Method), requires e-tag/if-match
/api/v2/carts/{{cartid}}/deliveries/assign

Payload
{"deliveryAssignment":{"deliveries":[{"person":{"firstName":"Pvo","lastName":"Renewals"},"deliveryMethod":{"id":10},"emailAddress":"pvo.renewalstest1@tickets.com"}]}}
custom_steps_separated.expected:
response code: 200
Extract the e-tag to pass for the Checkout Request
The response will be similar to lock response above so same validations as above step 2 can we reused, as well as under 
11) cart->reference->deliveries->delivery method is the one we provided in the payload

response code: 200
note this is package so we can try to extract few of the ticket id's instead of all when validating the request.
cart.

1) jsonResponseObject.cart.offers[0].lineItems[0].tickets[0].id
2) jsonResponseObject.cart.offers[0].lineItems[1].tickets[0].id
3) package and package key refers to the right package we selected during lock
4) jsonResponseObject.cart.payments[0].cardNumber).to.exist
5) "OrderID",jsonResponseObject.cart.reference.orders[0].id 
6) jsonResponseObject.cart.reference.deliveries[0].id).to.exist
7) jsonResponseObject.cart.transaction.id).to.exist

custom_steps_separated.content: Verify the ticket and order table is updated on the DB for the order and tickets purchased
custom_steps_separated.expected:
order/ transaction reflect in the table.
ticket table shows the status of ticket correctly: sold and fullypaid.

title: Verify Cancel Agreement when Cart Cancelled :  Single Reservation transaction with renewal category: Optional and Pay in full e-sign flag set to true
custom_preconds:
-Create a Renewal group (renewal category: optional)
-Create a package/associate an existing package with above Renewal Group
-Create a Signature Template
-Create a Payment plan with Signature Template selected and Require Signature Even if Order Paid in Full checked
-Create patron with credit 
-Complete 1 Package reservation transactions for the above patron

Set async.signature.cancel.agreements.enabled property true

custom_steps_separated.content:
Precondition 1:
Create a Renewal group (renewal category: optional)
-Login to PV application
-Navigate to Ticketing Setup
-Select the supplier from Supplier Administration
-Click Event Groups
-Select Renewal Group from "Event Group Type"
-Click New button
-Enter the Mandatory fields
Select renewal category "optional" 
-Click Save button
custom_steps_separated.expected: New Renewal Group created successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
Precondition 2:
Create a new Package or associate an existing Package with above Renewal Group
-Login to PV application
-Navigate to Package Administration
-Search existing package
-Assign the above Renewal Group(Renewal Group created in Precondition1)
custom_steps_separated.expected: Package created successfully & associated with Renewal Group

custom_steps_separated.content:
Precondition 3:
Create a Signature Template with application property online.renewals.esignatures.setup.enabled set to True 
-Login to PV application
-Navigate to System Setup
-Select the Organization from Organization Administration
-Navigate to Configuration tab
-Choose Signature Template from the Select Configuration dropwdown
-Click New button
-Enter the Mandatory fields
-Click Save button
custom_steps_separated.expected: New Signature Template created successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
Precondition 4:
Create a Payment plan
-Login PV application
-Navigate to Ticketing Setup
-Select the supplier from Supplier Administration
-Click Payment Plans
-Click New button
-Enter the Mandatory fields
select Use Scheduled Payments "Required"
_Enter the (No Of Installments/Fixed Start Date & Fixed Installment Period)
-Click Setup Installments button
-Choose Signature Template from the dropdown 
-Check Require Signature Even if Order Paid in Full checkbox
-Click Save button

Associate new payment plan with the package above
custom_steps_separated.expected: Payment plan created successfully

custom_steps_separated.content:
Precondition 5

Create patron with credit
-Login to PV application
-Navigate to Patron Management
-Search & select the MPV patron
-Navigate to Balance
-Click Add Credit button
-Enter the Mandatory fields(Supplier, Credit source ,Credit type & Amount) and click ok button
-Application will Navigate to Payment Page
-Click Accept Payment & click checkout

Note: To complete the sale with credit card payment, patron should provide digitalWalletItem id in checkout API request
Follow below steps if patron don't have a digitalWalletItem id
-Login PV application
-Navigate to Patron Management
-Search & select the MPV patron
-Navigate to wallet
-Select Payment type "Credit card"
-Click new
-Enter the mandatory fields
(Card Type/Card/Name on Card/Exp.Date)
-Check Default
-Click Save button
custom_steps_separated.expected: Account credit created for patron

custom_steps_separated.content: -Complete a Package reservation transactions for (Precondition 2)package with (Precondition 5)patron
custom_steps_separated.expected: Package reservation transaction completed successfully

custom_steps_separated.content: -Set async.signature.cancel.agreements.enabled property true
custom_steps_separated.expected: The application property should be set to true

title: Real-Time Fraud flow - Guest cart and checkout
custom_preconds:
- setup to integrate to RT or what is needed to mock the responses should be in place based on implementation.
 - Application property real.time.fraud.integration.feature.enabled should be set to 'true'.
 - Any other properties/ permissions that will be implemented for Real-Time Fraud should also be turned on (properties to be determined) note: if we are trying to mock a RTF response scenarios this test cases should use the address and card number/ amount to mimic those responses based on the configutation and the mock that will be implemented
custom_test_purpose: Verify flow of real-time fraud via a component test - mocking MPV calls and Accertify service.

custom_steps_separated.expected:
- Seats are locked, Cart ID is sent back in response.
 - If any information related to RTF enabling is implemented at a event or lock seats response than we should validate that information is present

- The checkout call to PV should initiate a request to accertify which would evaluate the data and check out api response as 200 (in observation mode)
 - note: additional feilds any that will be sent in the checkout response should be asserted once identified and implemented.

custom_steps_separated.content:
Request to accertify API should be logged (request docuemnted in the accertify integration documentation)

https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/BET/pages/4643880990/Real-Time+Fraud+Decision+Accertify+Integration+-+WIP
custom_steps_separated.expected: Check PV logs to see if PV initiate a call to ACCERTIFY similar to the sample, request mentioned in the design document.

custom_steps_separated.content:
Response from accertify API should be logged (response mentioned in the accertify integration documentation)
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/BET/pages/4643880990/Real-Time+Fraud+Decision+Accertify+Integration+-+WIP
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Check PV logs to see if PV dcoumented the response back from ACCERTIFY based on the sample, request mentioned in the design document.
The response score is documented into PV DB

custom_steps_separated.content: PV should also initiate a call to Payment processor after the response from accertify to process the credit card for payment
custom_steps_separated.expected: verify the call is made to processor or dummy in this case to process the payment and we get response back which will be used in the checkout

custom_preconds:
- setup to integrate to RT or what is needed to mock the responses should be in place based on implementation.

note:
if we are trying to mock a RTF response scenarios this test cases should use the address and card number/ amount to mimic those responses based on the configutation and the mock that will be implemented
custom_test_purpose: Verify flow of real-time fraud via a component test - mocking MPV calls and Accertify service.

custom_steps_separated.content:
Call Lock seats V2 APi with the relevant headers and request (Replace eventId and patron information.)

LOCK API Example:
Address: POST /api/v2/carts/lock
Content-Type: application/json
Headers: {Accept=[application/json], Authorization=[Basic (Password not shown)], pv-application-id=[com.tickets.clientapp], 
Username: {{apiuser}}
PV-API-Key: (valid api key)
Payload: 
{"lockSeats":{"event":{"id":5632},"transactionPatronAccount":{"id":54883},"numberOfSeats":2,"creditsRequested":true,"saleType":"SINGLE","buyerTypeSeatsList":[{"buyerType":{"id":1201},"numberOfSeats":2}],"priceScales":[{"id":2665}],"accessible":"false","sections":[{"id":3183}]}}
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Seats are locked, Cart ID is sent back in response.
If any information related to RTF enabling is implemented at a event or lock seats response than we should validate that information is present

custom_steps_separated.content:
Assign Delivery to the locked seats.

NOTE:  Get the cart ID from step 1 response.

Address: PUT /api/v2/carts/350256334/deliveries/assign
Content-Type: application/json
Headers: {Accept=[application/json], Authorization=[Basic (Password not shown)],if-match=["ETAGE from lock"],pv-application-id=[com.tickets.clientapp], 
Username: {{apiuser}}
PV-API-Key: (valid api key)
Payload: 
{"deliveryAssignment":{"deliveries":[{"person":{"firstName":"Rivi","lastName":"Asd"},"deliveryMethod":{"id":10},"emailAddress":"rivisaf283@dpcos.com"}]}}
custom_steps_separated.expected: Should get a successful response back - 200 With a delivery assigned and update sales amount is   Example response:

The checkout call to PV should initiate a request to accertify which would evaluate the data and check out api response as 200 (in observation mode)
note: additional feilds any that will be sent in the checkout response should be asserted once identified and implemented.

custom_steps_separated.content:
Request to accertify API should be logged (request docuemnted in the accertify integration documentation)

https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/BET/pages/4643880990/Real-Time+Fraud+Decision+Accertify+Integration+-+WIP
custom_steps_separated.expected: Check PV logs to see if PV initiate a call to ACCERTIFY similar to the sample, request mentioned in the design document.

custom_steps_separated.content:
Response from accertify API should be logged (response mentioned in the accertify integration documentation)
https://baseball.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/BET/pages/4643880990/Real-Time+Fraud+Decision+Accertify+Integration+-+WIP
custom_steps_separated.expected:
Check PV logs to see if PV dcoumented the response back from ACCERTIFY based on the sample, request mentioned in the design document.
The response score is documented into PV DB

custom_steps_separated.content: PV should also initiate a call to Payment processor after the response from accertify to process the credit card for payment
custom_steps_separated.expected: verify the call is made to processor or dummy in this case to process the payment and we get response back which will be used in the checkout
